verses.verse: Furthermore Elihu <WH453> answered <WH6030> and said, <WH559>
Hear <WH8085> my words, <WH4405> O ye wise <WH2450> men; and give ear <WH238> unto me, ye that have knowledge. <WH3045>
For <WH3588> the ear <WH241> trieth <WH974> words, <WH4405> as the mouth <WH2441> tasteth <WH2938> meat. <WH398>
Let us choose <WH977> to us judgment: <WH4941> let us know <WH3045> among <WH996> ourselves what <WH4100> is good. <WH2896>
For <WH3588> Job <WH347> hath said, <WH559> I am righteous: <WH6663> and God <WH410> hath taken away <WH5493> my judgment. <WH4941>
Should I lie <WH3576> against <WH5921> my right? <WH4941> my wound <WH2671> is incurable <WH605> without <WH1097> transgression. <WH6588>
What <WH4310> man <WH1397> is like Job, <WH347> who drinketh up <WH8354> scorning <WH3933> like water? <WH4325>
Which goeth <WH732> in company <WH2274> with <WH5973> the workers <WH6466> of iniquity, <WH205> and walketh <WH1980> with <WH5973> wicked <WH7562> men. <WH376>
For <WH3588> he hath said, <WH559> It profiteth <WH5532> a man <WH1397> nothing <WH3808> that he should delight <WH7521> himself with <WH5973> God. <WH430>

Therefore <WH3651> hearken <WH8085> unto me, ye men <WH376> of understanding: <WH3824> far be it <WH2486> from God, <WH410> that he should do wickedness; <WH4480> <WH7562> and from the Almighty, <WH7706> that he should commit iniquity. <WH4480> <WH5766>
For <WH3588> the work <WH6467> of a man <WH120> shall he render <WH7999> unto him, and cause every man <WH376> to find <WH4672> according to his ways. <WH734>
Yea, <WH637> surely <WH551> God <WH410> will not <WH3808> do wickedly, <WH7561> neither <WH3808> will the Almighty <WH7706> pervert <WH5791> judgment. <WH4941>
Who <WH4310> hath given him a charge <WH6485> <WH5921> over the earth? <WH776> or who <WH4310> hath disposed <WH7760> the whole <WH3605> world? <WH8398>
If <WH518> he set <WH7760> his heart <WH3820> upon <WH413> man, if he gather <WH622> unto <WH413> himself his spirit <WH7307> and his breath; <WH5397>
All <WH3605> flesh <WH1320> shall perish <WH1478> together, <WH3162> and man <WH120> shall turn again <WH7725> unto <WH5921> dust. <WH6083>
If <WH518> now thou hast understanding, <WH998> hear <WH8085> this: <WH2063> hearken <WH238> to the voice <WH6963> of my words. <WH4405>
Shall even <WH637> he that hateth <WH8130> right <WH4941> govern? <WH2280> and wilt thou condemn <WH7561> him that is most <WH3524> just? <WH6662>
Is it fit to say <WH559> to a king, <WH4428> Thou art wicked? <WH1100> and to <WH413> princes, <WH5081> Ye are ungodly? <WH7563>

How much less to him that <WH834> accepteth <WH5375> not <WH3808> the persons <WH6440> of princes, <WH8269> nor <WH3808> regardeth <WH5234> the rich <WH7771> more than <WH6440> the poor? <WH1800> for <WH3588> they all <WH3605> are the work <WH4639> of his hands. <WH3027>

In a moment <WH7281> shall they die, <WH4191> and the people <WH5971> shall be troubled <WH1607> at midnight, <WH2676> <WH3915> and pass away: <WH5674> and the mighty <WH47> shall be taken away <WH5493> without <WH3808> hand. <WH3027>
For <WH3588> his eyes <WH5869> are upon <WH5921> the ways <WH1870> of man, <WH376> and he seeth <WH7200> all <WH3605> his goings. <WH6806>
There is no <WH369> darkness, <WH2822> nor <WH369> shadow of death, <WH6757> where <WH8033> the workers <WH6466> of iniquity <WH205> may hide themselves. <WH5641>
For <WH3588> he will not <WH3808> lay <WH7760> upon <WH5921> man <WH376> more <WH5750> than right; that he should enter <WH1980> into judgment <WH4941> with <WH413> God. <WH410>
He shall break in pieces <WH7489> mighty men <WH3524> without <WH3808> number, <WH2714> and set <WH5975> others <WH312> in their stead. <WH8478>
Therefore <WH3651> he knoweth <WH5234> their works, <WH4566> and he overturneth <WH2015> them in the night, <WH3915> so that they are destroyed. <WH1792>
He striketh <WH5606> them as <WH8478> wicked men <WH7563> in the open <WH4725> sight <WH7200> of others;
Because <WH834> <WH3651> <WH5921> they turned back <WH5493> from <WH4480> <WH310> him, and would not <WH3808> consider <WH7919> any <WH3605> of his ways: <WH1870>
So that they cause the cry <WH6818> of the poor <WH1800> to come <WH935> unto <WH5921> him, and he heareth <WH8085> the cry <WH6818> of the afflicted. <WH6041>

When he <WH1931> giveth quietness, <WH8252> who <WH4310> then can make trouble? <WH7561> and when he hideth <WH5641> his face, <WH6440> who <WH4310> then can behold <WH7789> him? whether it be done against <WH5921> a nation, <WH1471> or against <WH5921> a man <WH120> only: <WH3162>
That the hypocrite <WH120> <WH2611> reign not, <WH4480> <WH4427> lest the people <WH5971> be ensnared. <WH4480> <WH4170>
Surely it is meet <WH3588> to be said <WH559> unto <WH413> God, <WH410> I have borne <WH5375> chastisement, I will not <WH3808> offend <WH2254> any more:
That which I see <WH2372> not <WH1107> teach <WH3384> thou <WH859> me: if <WH518> I have done <WH6466> iniquity, <WH5766> I will do <WH3254> no <WH3808> more.

Should it be according to thy mind? <WH4480> <WH5973> he will recompense <WH7999> it, whether <WH3588> thou refuse, <WH3988> or whether <WH3588> thou <WH859> choose; <WH977> and not <WH3808> I: <WH589> therefore speak <WH1696> what <WH4100> thou knowest. <WH3045>
Let men <WH376> of understanding <WH3824> tell <WH559> me, and let a wise <WH2450> man <WH1397> hearken <WH8085> unto me.
Job <WH347> hath spoken <WH1696> without <WH3808> knowledge, <WH1847> and his words <WH1697> were without <WH3808> wisdom. <WH7919>
My desire <WH15> is that Job <WH347> may be tried <WH974> unto <WH5704> the end <WH5331> because <WH5921> of his answers <WH8666> for wicked <WH205> men. <WH376>
For <WH3588> he addeth <WH3254> rebellion <WH6588> unto <WH5921> his sin, <WH2403> he clappeth <WH5606> his hands among <WH996> us, and multiplieth <WH7235> his words <WH561> against God. <WH410>
